d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Test your mettle in a race with thunder. Reserved for a brave few, it's 12 kilometers of willpower vs horsepower. From the Dam to the Station, along the scenic route of the Heber Valley Railroad, you will write the next chapter in the iconic story of Man and Machine.
___ Will you make it back to the platform before the Mighty Train? There's only one way to find out.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: The Dam Train Race

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: From its inception in 1992, the Downtown Farmers Market has become a summer tradition for Salt Lake City residents and visitors. Located in historic Pioneer Park, the Saturday Farmers Market has infused vitality into the middle ground between East Bench and West Side neighborhoods.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Downtown Farmers Market

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: Registration for creative dance, satellite, ballet, hip hop, and Dancers with Disabilities classes for the the 2016-2017 school year is now available.It should be an amazing year of dance.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Tanner Dance Classes

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
DogFest Walk 'N Roll **Grab a Leash! **Join the fun at this accessible, family- and dog-friendly walk and festival, benefiting Canine Companions for Independence and the mission of providing highly trained assistance dogs to people with disabilities free of charge.
Register for free
Form a team
Collect donations
Walk 'n roll
Change a life
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: DogFest Walk 'N Roll

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: The First Annual Zion Art Exhibition is an opportunity to view the winning works of our first competition, showcasing LDS artists in conjunction General Conference in downtown SLC. Come and meet the artists, learn about their works, and help us spread the word of the amazing talents of the more than 10,000 LDS artists working today.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Zion Art Exhibition

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: This is a charity ride event\. We are launching a 501c\(3\) non\-profit foundation called The Riderz Foundation\. We assist injured motorcyclists who are in distress by helping them with education, recovery and support\. When a rider goes down, the Riderz step up\. The event will have a concert with live music, food trucks, raffles, games, auctions, prize drawings, poker run, best bike in show and best pin\-up girl contests\.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: The Riderz Foundation Rockabilly Charity Ride Event & Concert

d2p1:jsLink.d2p1:name: The Riderz Foundation Rockabilly Charity Ride Event & Concert

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: Come visit our Harvest Days/Farmers Market where local farmers come to sell their produce and we also have other vendors as well. Come early for the best selection. While you're here, you can also tour the Benson Grist Mill Historic Site. Hope to see you there!
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Harvest Days/Farmers Market

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: Learn the distinctive style and techniques of screen printing, the art form made famous by Andy Warhol. Demonstrations and hands-on experience will guide you through each step, from creating an image to preparing the screen to printing: first a simple image to paper, then a two-color image to paper and finally a one-color image to a wearable t-shirt. Learn to use screen printing equipment and materials safely and effectively. Special fee includes screen printing screen and a tee-shirt to take home at the end of class. Class is limited to eight people. No artistic experience is necessary.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Screen Printing (LLCFT 224)

d2p1:ct.d2p1:name: Jonathan Harman
d2p1:ct.d2p1:org: University of Utah Continuing Education and Community Engagement / Lifelong Learning

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: The Junior League is excited to host our 7th Annual Touch\-A\-Truck event\! Touch\-A\-Truck is a family fun event offering kids of all ages a hands on experience to explore large vehicles, see how they work, and even sit in the drivers seat\! These large vehicles include construction trucks, utility trucks, emergency responder vehicles, helicopters, and more\! Quiet hour will be held from 10a\-11a for kids who might be scared of horns and sirens\. Go to www\.jlslc\.org to purchase tickets\! Individual Tickets $5 Family Pass \(up to 5 individuals\) $20 If you are interested in partnering with us for the 2016 Annual Touch a Truck event, please contact events@jlslc\.org
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: 7th Annual Touch-A-Truck event!

d2p1:jsLink.d2p1:name: SUIndependent
d2p1:jsLink.d2p1:url: http://Individual Tickets $5 Family Pass (up to 5 individuals) $20

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
The atmosphere at the People's Market is friendly and inviting. Visit with our local artisans, enjoy fresh prepared food, purchase some of the best produce to be found locally, and enjoy the live performances by local musicians.
We have different Special Events through out the Season, including Book Day where you can swap books with others at the Market, and Pet Day when we promote the many rescue organizations who bring out wonderful animals who are in need of good homes. We also promote the talented youth of the community to come: to learn arts and crafts, sell items that they have made themselves, or even perform musically during open mic sessions at the Market.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: 9th West Farmers Market

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Calling all gamers! What if there was an event or league for kids that loved competitive games, just like there are for kids that love sports? There is! Enter Minecraft Adventure by Super League Gaming.
___
Kids 6-16 years old are invited to experience a thrilling 90 minutes of fun and friendly competition while playing Minecraft in a movie theatre near you. Dive into a smorgasbord of some of the best games and maps, make friends and enjoy the action on the big screen.
___
Each player has their own laptop, which enables a first-person Point of View of the game. The movie screen offers a Bird's Eye View, showing the action of everyone playing in the theatre. Please check the below link to see visuals highlighting the vibrant, fun-filled gaming action to be had with Minecraft Adventure: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tlL1CSNyx6k
___
90 minutes isn’t enough? Sign up for the weekly league events at your local theatre and join a competitive team come October for Metropolis Madness.
___ Note: You must bring a LAPTOP (not tablet or phone) with Minecraft version 1.10 installed.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Minecraft Adventure by Super League Gaming in Salt Lake City

d2p1:jsLink.d2p1:name: Minecraft Adventure by Super League Gaming in Salt Lake City

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Join us for our 1st annual Cars for K.S.A Fundraiser Car Show.
___
This event is FREE to the public and is a family event. Have an old car? Bring it on down and help support our school.
We will have Food Trucks, Music, Vendors, Raffles and some amazing cars. All cars must be registered for the event and cost is a $20.00 donation.
So, please come down and support our School!
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Cars for K.S.A (Kearns Saint Anns) Car show Fundraiser

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Join us for a 4th West Oktoberfest celebration with Red Rock Brewing and Mountain West Hard Cider libations!
___
Friday, September 30: 3pm - 10pm
Saturday, October 1: 11am - 10pm
Sunday, October 2: 12pm - 5pm
___
Live Bands! And DJ Justin Godina!
Candy's River House - Friday, 7:00pm to 10:00pm
Tony Holiday and the Velvetones - Saturday, 1:00pm to 4:00pm
Hectic Hobo - Saturday, 7:00pm to 10:00pm
Talia Keys - Sunday, 12:00pm to 2:30pm
Michelle Moonshine - Sunday, 2:30pm to 5:00pm
___
Food Trucks!
Poutine Your Mouth, Tacos Don Rafa, SPUDS, Bumblebee's KBBQ & Grill (Saturday only), Shylo's Mobile Cafe (Saturday and Sunday only)
Games!
**corn hole | giant Jenga | ring toss | beer pong | children's craft table | etc. **
$7 admission per person includes a limited edition mug.
VIP admission also available and includes a food buffet catered by Garage On Beck, limited edition mug, and two drink tickets.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: 4th West Oktoberfest
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:PriceText: $7 admission includes a free limited edition mug!

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: Join local author and illustrator, Jake Parker, for a reading and signing of his new picture book, Little Bot and Sparrow. When Little Bot is thrown out with the garbage, he meets his first true friend, a bird named Sparrow, who takes him under her wing. Sparrow teaches Little Bot about the perils of flying, her wild world, and the importance of dreaming. As winter arrives, Sparrow must leave and fly south, and they share a tearful good bye. Little Bot revisits where he and Sparrow shared happy memories, and that night, for the first time, he dreams--of him and Sparrow taking flight together. Places in the signing line are reserved for those who purchase a copy of Little Bot and Sparrow from The King's English. GET YOUR COPY NOW! Pre-order your signed copy of Little Bot and Sparrow today, by either calling the store at 801-484-9100 or ordering online. Please specify if you will be attending the event and if you want your book personalized.

d2p1:jsLink.d2p1:name: Jake Parker: Little Bot and Sparrow

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Jake Parker: Little Bot and Sparrow

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: CUAC is pleased to present Discover Zaqistan: The Art of Adventure by the Zaqistan Tourism Board. The Republic of Zaqistan is located just west of the Great Salt Lake. Founded in 2005 by New York City-based artist Zaq Landsberg as a response to the political climate at the time, the project continues to be conceptually tied to current events. This year, Zaqistan is opening up its doors to tourism and partnering with *CUAC* to host expeditions into the desolate nation as well as an exhibition on the country.

d2p1:jsLink.d2p1:name: Discover Zaqistan: The Art of Adventure

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Discover Zaqistan: The Art of Adventure

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: Purchase your tickets to Utah's largest paranormal festival. Meet local paranormal experts, browse the vendor booths, attend the panels conducted by our special panelist. Come down and meet our special guest in person and get to know them. If you order your ticket online prior to the event the price is just $10 plus small ticket fee. TICKETS PURCHASED AT THE EVENT DOOR WILL BE $15 SO ORDER ONLINE TODAY!!! We will also be having a monthly investigation in support of this event. And we will be posting guests and events as we get them set up.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: 2016 Utah Paranormal Festival
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Venue: Karen Gail Miller Conference Center - KGMC

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Sample and taste all of the best local Utah Craft Beers while tasting Bavarian Inspired Foods and treats
Sample beers from Bohemian Brewery, Uinta Brewing, Squatters Beers, Wasatch Beers, Red Rock Brewery, Roosters Brewery, 10 Barrel Brewing Company, Payette Brewing Company and more!
Earl’s Lodge and Patio
No Reservation Required
Price: $2.50 per sampling token
Samples are poured at 6oz. (2) Tokens Required for Heavy Beer sample. (2) Tokens to fill Mug and (3) Tokens to fill mug with Heavy Beer.
Tokens purchased Saturday October 1st can be redeemed on October 2nd. Tokens have no cash value after October 2nd. Token sales end one hour before close each day.
Packages:
Beer Fest Sample Mug with (4) Tokens $30
Beer Fest Sample Mug and (10) Tokens $45
The King of Beer Fest package: A special Mug with 12 tokens, a special King of Beer Fest crown, a T-shirt, and VIP access to the front of the line from specific breweries. $125 – limited to the first (50) and after 50 we will sell out!
Entertainment:
Saturday – Pimps of Joytime, Candy's River House and Pinetop Inferno
Sunday – Leftover Cuties, Dead Winter Carpenters and Hollering Pines
SUNDAY, OCTOBER 2 - KING OF BEER FEST COSTUME CONTEST
3:30pm – the winner of ‘King of Beer Fest’ will be announced which will include a 16.17 season pass. Those ‘King of Beer Fest’ participants are encouraged to dress up and play the part. Sunday at around 2:00pm someone will tap you on the shoulder and invite you to the King of Beer Fest awards at 3:30 at the front of the main stage. Questions, Dancing, and stories will be told while the crowd picks the True King of Beer Fest which will include your name on a wall in the Cinnabar, and bragging rights for life. 2nd prize gets a $125 Snowbasin Resort Gift Card.
Stay at Lakeside Resort Properties this weekend and get a free shuttle to and from your condo PLUS 20% off your stay. See lakesideresortproperties.com/beer-fest-2016 for details.
Must be 21 years of age or older with valid ID to consume alcohol.
***No outside food or beverage allowed in the music venue or the lodge. Utah State Law prohibits the possession and consumption of outside alcohol including beer & wine on premise. Bags may be subject to search at the music venue gate and any alcohol or outside food may be confiscated.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Basin Beer Fest
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:PriceText: Three packages available at $30, $45, $125. $2.50 per token.

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Join Wasatch Community Gardens for an open house tour of this community garden!
___
- Tour of the garden
- Garden games

- Photo booth
___
For additional questions, contact Chloe Stevens, Outreach AmeriCorps at chloe@wasatchgardens.org or call 801.359.2658.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Community Garden Open House

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: Come and enjoy each others company, incredible music by Wilford Prater and the Jordan Youth Choir, and a memorial walk around the gorgeous gardens\.

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Learn Poi, Staff, Double Staff, Eating, and Prop Building!
Lorin has over 12 years of experience as a professional dancer, fire artist and teacher.
___
4 Saturdays: September 17, September 24, October 1, October 8
2pm - 4pm
SLC Arts Hub (663 W. 100 S.)
$80 for the 4-class workshop (practice props included)
All levels are welcome, ages 10 and up. Individual instruction will be given from each student’s current starting point.
___
*Please Note!* A minimum of six (6) students is required in order for this workshop to run. All participants must register for the entire workshop, no drop-in classes will be available. If the workshop does not run, registration fees will be refunded through PayPal.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Samba Fogo Fire Spinning Workshop
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:PriceText: $80 for the 4-class workshop - practice props included

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Pioneer Theatre Company presents the regional premiere of *The Last Ship*, the semi-autobiographical lyrical musical by the world-renowned musician Sting. Sting wrote the music and lyrics; the book was written by the Tony and Pulitzer Prize-winning writers John Logan and Brian Yorkey.
The musical will run from September 16 - October 1, 2016. Tickets for the production go on sale to the general public beginning August 31, 2016 at 10 a.m. ___
PTC's production will be the first since the show's Tony-nominated (Best Original Score) Broadway run in 2014-2015. PTC is the only theatre in the country given the honor of producing the musical that *The New York Times* said features, "a seductive score that ranks among the best composed by a rock or pop figure on Broadway."
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: The Last Ship
